page.title: 16HOUSING
page.content: The old houses of Sunderland consist of two types;cottages,these are single storey terraced dwellings consisting of one or two bedrooms,living room a kitchen,with water closet and coalshed situated in the yard at the back,many show signs of modernization.Townhouses,many are terraced and may be three or four storeys,large bay windows,steps to the front door and ornate cast iron railings.Again a small yard at the back.Both these housing types feature a back alley for access by tradesmen. Modern houses similar to other areas include estates of three bedroom semis with small gardens. Some terraced infill development,replacing previous derelict properties,and a number of recent tower blocks of flats showing vandalism.
